subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Pronoun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|pronoun|か}}

# [[distal]] [[demonstrative]], something far off [[removed]] from both speaker and listener: [[that]], [[yon]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かれ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かれ}}. Compound of {{suffix|ja|sort=かれ|彼|tr1=ka|t1=that, yon|れ|tr2=re|pos2=nominalizing suffix for demonstratives}}. Found in the ''[[w:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]'' compiled around 759.

subSections.title: Pronoun
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|か|o1=の}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かの|彼|tr1=ka|t1=that, yon|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronoun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The term ''kano'' has been mostly replaced by {{ja-r|あの}} in modern Japanese. ''Kano'' is still in use, but is viewed as more [[formal]] and [[archaic]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あれ}}
Compound of {{suffix|ja|sort=あれ|彼|tr1=a|t1=that, yon|れ|tr2=re|pos2=nominalizing suffix for demonstratives}}.

subSections.title: Pronoun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|pronoun|あれ}}

# [[distal]] [[demonstrative]], something far off [[removed]] from both speaker and listener: [[that]], [[yon]]
# third person pronoun: [[he]], [[she]], [[it]]
# second person pronoun: [[you]]
# a euphemism for sex: [[it]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: More often spelled in hiragana, as {{ja-l|あれ}}.
